intro: Weinmannia croftii, commonly known as the Croft’s weinmannia, is a shrub or small tree native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, yellowish-green flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal climates with mild winters and warm, dry summers. Its leaves are often leathery and have a distinctive, serrated margin, while its flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Weinmannia croftii is an important plant in local ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
